questions.stem: What is the most common cause of anemia in children worldwide?
questions.explanation: Iron deficiency is by far the most common cause of anemia in the pediatric population globally, primarily due to nutritional factors.

questions.stem: A 2-year-old child presents with pallor and fatigue. A complete blood count shows microcytic, hypochromic anemia. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?
questions.explanation: Microcytic, hypochromic anemia in a toddler is the classic presentation of iron deficiency anemia.
